meanings.definition: To make something modern or current in style or form.
meanings.sent1: She decided to contemporize her wardrobe by adding some trendy pieces.
meanings.sent2: The designer chose to contemporize the classic dress with a modern twist.
meanings.sent3: Trying to contemporize a vintage outfit with neon colors might be a bit too much.
meanings.sent4: The artist managed to contemporize the ancient painting by incorporating digital elements.
meanings.sent5: His goal was to contemporize the traditional recipe by using innovative cooking techniques.

meanings.definition: To bring something up to date.
meanings.sent1: The company needed to contemporize its marketing strategies to reach a younger audience.
meanings.sent2: It's important to contemporize the software regularly to ensure security.
meanings.sent3: He tried to contemporize his old phone by adding new features, but it didn't work well.
meanings.sent4: The teacher had to contemporize the lesson plan to include online resources for the students.
meanings.sent5: The museum decided to contemporize the exhibit by adding interactive displays.

meanings.definition: To adapt something to the present time.
meanings.sent1: The architect had to contemporize the building design to meet current safety standards.
meanings.sent2: She worked hard to contemporize the family business and attract younger customers.
meanings.sent3: Trying to contemporize an ancient tradition with modern technology can be challenging.
meanings.sent4: The author's goal was to contemporize the classic story by setting it in a modern city.
meanings.sent5: The chef had to contemporize the menu to include more plant-based options for health-conscious diners.
